nodes.author: github-actions
nodes.body:
**Triage Summary**

Labels will be applied to indicate the affected platform (Android), the related area (core platform/runtime), and note that this is a potential regression.

This issue is a regression since the user confirmed that it worked in a previous version of .NET MAUI but fails in the current version.

<details>
<summary>Detailed Summary and Actions</summary>

Summary of the triage:

- The issue explicitly occurs on the Android platform and includes Android-specific details such as logs.
- It pertains to core platform/runtime crashes involving Mono and MonoDroid, rather than an issue with a specific control like CollectionView.
- This is a regression, as per the user's report that the functionality worked in an earlier .NET MAUI version and is now broken.

Summary of the actions that will be performed:

| Action | Item | Description |
| :----- | :--- | :---------- |
| Apply Label | platform/android | The issue explicitly states that the crash occurs on Android and includes relevant platform-specific details. |
| Apply Label | area-core-platform | The crash is related to the Mono and MonoDroid runtimes, classifying it as a core platform integration issue rather than a control-related issue. |
| Apply Label | potential-regression | The user mentions the issue was functional in a previous version, indicating a regression. |

</details>



_This entire triage process was automated by AI and mistakes may have been made. Please let us know so we can continue to improve._

@SpaceTimee,  The attached repro sample is still not compiling on our end due to missing assembly references. Could you please share a simplified, runnable .NET MAUI sample that reproduces the issue? This will help us proceed further more quickly.

nodes.author: SpaceTimee
nodes.body: I found the problem — it was caused by too many layers of nested controls in `CollectionView.ItemTemplate`. After removing one layer of `Grid`, the app no longer crashes

nodes.author: SpaceTimee
nodes.body:
Hi, this issue is reopened. I made a sample these days:

https://github.com/SpaceTimee/Maui-Issue-29752

The app will crash after open, close, and reopen the detail page several times (about 8, maybe more in some environments), like below:

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/43c26c03-4023-49ac-bc1d-ab4bb272499a

The number of times it takes to crash seems to be related to the amount of data in CollectionView.ItemsSource, the depth of nesting in CollectionView.ItemTemplate, and whether CollectionView.Header and CollectionView.Footer are present

nodes.author: SpaceTimee
nodes.body: @anandhan-rajagopal Could you please take a look at this issue

nodes.author: TamilarasanSF4853
nodes.body: This issue has been verified in Visual Studio Code 1.101.1 with MAUI versions (9.0.0, 9.0.80 & 8.0.100). It can be reproduced on Android platform from MAUI version 9.0.0, It has not reproduced on the MAUI version 8.0.100.

nodes.body: I wanted to share a positive update on this issue. After updating to .NET 9.0.7, this crash has completely disappeared in my MAUI Android project.

title: [Android] Crash - condition `xref_count == xref_index' not met, function:processing_build_callback_data

author: aw3-1337
body: ### Description During application run I have some random fatal signal errors (1, 6 and 11 mostly), they occur very rarely and are very hard to reproduce. I was not able to recreate this issue in a small-sample app and the issue itself occurs on a big project, which has a lot of corporate info, thus I am not able to share it either. ### Reproduction Steps The general info about the application: This is MAUI Android project. The app uses a lot of memory and stores up to 3000 objects in a list, during initial load it calculates values from objects in this list and preloads images for these objects. The app has a screen which contains info about a product, this screen is created at runtime and then stored for a future reuse (it is heavely reused during application use), the screen itself is pretty simple and it's picture could be found below: Sometimes (very randomly) when app pushes this page to a navigation stack it crashes with fatal signal. ### Expected behavior Page is being pushed and rendered ### Actual behavior Application crashes with fatal signal related to libmonosgen-2.0.so or libmonodroid.so Logs of crahes are in attachment (app is aw3.apps.remerch) [log.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22010871/log.txt) [log4.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22010872/log4.txt) [log3.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22010873/log3.txt) [log2.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22010870/log2.txt) ### Regression? It did occur in net9.0-android, but did not test on earlier versions ### Known Workarounds _No response_ ### Configuration .NET: 10.0-android (preview6) OS: Android Architecture: ARM64 Is specific: don't know ### Other information Could be useful in solving: Problematic screen had some hidden controls (not visible at the start), which had animations attached. Animations were created at runtime, mainly because the length of the animation and parameter length were calculated based on some model values. On every page load there is a cleanup for the animations attached to these controls. If this control was not shown for a long time a crash would occur during page load (could be connected to clearing animation state). I have removed animations and deleted controls, now these controls are created at user's request. Can not confirm if this has solved the problem, but haven't experienced any new crashes yet (more testing is being done)

nodes.author: SejalH96
nodes.body:
@BrzVlad, were you able to find some time to review the stack trace?

We have noticed the following behaviour after updating the .NET version:

.NET 9.0.7

iOS app crashed within 1–1.5 hours

Android app crashed within 7–8 hours

.NET 9.0.8

iOS app crashed after 6–7 hours

Android app crashed after 19–20 hours

The update has certainly improved stability, but it seems there may still be an underlying issue.

title: Frequent crashes after migrating from Xamarin to .Net in libmonosgen2.0.so

author: jurganson
body: ### Description Having an app that runs large amount of data through a XML ToString(), using the `System.XML`, performs very poorly in .NET 9 iOS, compared to .NET 8 In the reproduction repo(s) I have set up a simple UI with a spinner animation and a list that can be scrolled. When pressing the button, 40000 entries are serialized to XML using the following code: ``` var xmlResults = _xmlTestData.Select(x => x.Serialize()).ToList(); ``` where `Serialize()` is implemented like: ``` using (var sw = new StringWriter()) { var settings = new XmlWriterSettings { CheckCharacters = false }; using (var xw = XmlWriter.Create(sw, settings)) xe.WriteTo(xw); return sw.ToString(); } ``` The results shows a general impact on performance running both release and debug, however a very big gap between .NET 9 and 8 in release mode on iOS. There seems to be no performance gain in release mode from debug on .NET 9. Furthermore, the UI thread is heavily impacted. In the repro you can start the background work and try to scroll the included list, which will lag a lot. This is not the same behavior on .NET 8, where the UI thread is able to scroll smoothly as well. All images below are from the reproduction apps, linked below: _Tested on a iPhone 15 Pro Max_ For comparison, here is the same results, comparing Android: _Tested on an Samsung Galaxy S23_ In Android we see consistent results across both .NET versions, in debug and release. Both reproduction apps in .NET 8 and 9 can be picked up here, where the only difference is the target .NET version: [.NET 9 repo](https://github.com/jurganson/backgroundtasksblocksmainthreadnet9) [.NET 8 repo](https://github.com/jurganson/backgroundtasksblocksmainthreadnet8) ### Steps to Reproduce - Run the repo apps on an iOS device in release mode. - See the significant difference in general UI thread performance and resulting time performance. - Scroll the list for extra jitters. ### Link to public reproduction project repository _No response_ ### Version with bug 9.0.100 SR10 ### Is this a regression from previous behavior? Yes, this used to work in .NET MAUI ### Last version that worked well .NET 8 (Please specify exact version) ### Affected platforms iOS ### Affected platform versions iOS 15 and up ### Did you find any workaround? Not at the moment no. Trying to create a simple DIY XML serializer, yielding a lot better results, however questionable for a production build. One experiment that seemed to work rather well was to introduce a batched .Select, which would call `.Select(x => x.Serialize)` in a batched loop (with a batch size of about 200 yielding the best result) but most importantly, with a `Thread.Sleep(2)` between batches. ### Relevant log output ```shell ```

nodes.author: jurganson
nodes.body:
Other observations have been that if sequentially batching the .Select by around 200 entries, with a Thread.Sleep in between, I can almost acquire similar performance in .NET9. However, the UI thread is still heavily impacted, making scrolling almost impossible while the operation is running, even when the entire operation is run in a Task.Run. On .NET8, it was faster and no UI thread interference.

When analysing a dotnet trace, I see a lot of the time is used in XmlWriter.Create()

I would certainly be up for more experimenting and digging further, since this is a critical issue for me, but at this point I am unsure where to look.

nodes.author: rolfbjarne
nodes.body:
I can reproduce this, and I created a smaller test project for Mac Catalyst that can be run from the command line easily: https://github.com/rolfbjarne/slowxmlserialization

The output from the test (which also tests plain a .NET 8/9/10 console app as well):

```
.NET 8 / Mac Catalyst
2025-09-11 15:45:25.279 slowxmlserialization[38552:11447986] Started serialization...
2025-09-11 15:45:27.165 slowxmlserialization[38552:11447986] Completed serialization.
2025-09-11 15:45:27.165 slowxmlserialization[38552:11447986] Serialized 40000 objects to XML. Total length: 81767024 characters.
2025-09-11 15:45:27.165 slowxmlserialization[38552:11447986] Serialization took 1.8860795 seconds

.NET 9 / Mac Catalyst
2025-09-11 15:45:29.068 slowxmlserialization[38558:11448088] Started serialization...
2025-09-11 15:46:54.201 slowxmlserialization[38558:11448088] Completed serialization.
2025-09-11 15:46:54.201 slowxmlserialization[38558:11448088] Serialized 40000 objects to XML. Total length: 81914176 characters.
2025-09-11 15:46:54.201 slowxmlserialization[38558:11448088] Serialization took 85.1340045 seconds

.NET 10 / Mac Catalyst
2025-09-11 15:46:55.178 slowxmlserialization[38598:11449641] Started serialization...
2025-09-11 15:48:17.686 slowxmlserialization[38598:11449641] Completed serialization.
2025-09-11 15:48:17.686 slowxmlserialization[38598:11449641] Serialized 40000 objects to XML. Total length: 81773367 characters.
2025-09-11 15:48:17.686 slowxmlserialization[38598:11449641] Serialization took 82.5087144 seconds

.NET 8
Started serialization...
Completed serialization.
Serialized 40000 objects to XML. Total length: 81667091 characters.
Serialization took 1.5615791 seconds

.NET 9
Started serialization...
Completed serialization.
Serialized 40000 objects to XML. Total length: 81785488 characters.
Serialization took 1.5489998 seconds

.NET 10
Started serialization...
Completed serialization.
Serialized 40000 objects to XML. Total length: 81727084 characters.
Serialization took 1.5507728 seconds
```

.NET 9/10 Mac Catalyst is ~40x slower than .NET 8 Mac Catalyst, or any plain .NET console app.

Running a bit in Instruments, this looks GC related, because most of the time is spent in the GC.

nodes.author: rolfbjarne
nodes.body:
> Running a bit in Instruments, this looks GC related, because most of the time is spent in the GC.

Running with `MONO_LOG_LEVEL=debug MONO_LOG_MASK=gc` reveals a rather stark difference between [`net8.0-maccatalyst`](https://github.com/rolfbjarne/slowxmlserialization/blob/main/net8.0-maccatalyst-gc.log) and [`net9.0-maccatalyst`](https://github.com/rolfbjarne/slowxmlserialization/blob/main/net9.0-maccatalyst-gc.log).

title: [iOS] .NET 9 System.Xml significant performance drop compared to .NET 8
